pullRequest.title: Display name of the user who created the feature under title

nodes.bodyText: This is really ui-specific logic and thus doesn't belong in the model.. could you please move this into the viewmodel instead?

commit.message: Display name of feature's creator under name title
Move logic for converting feature to title/subtitle

afterCommit.message: Move logic for converting feature to title/subtitle

nodes.bodyText: We generally don't add "Optional" to optionals unless there's a name clash - In a sense, in this case "optional" can be treated as a quality of the variable like type and nullability (e.g. we don't use "nameString" or "idNullable").
Also, can we make this arg @NonNull?
Same comment re arg name here and throughout.
Same comment re "observable" prefix - it can be considered part of how the values are delivered (the how) rather than what is being delivered (the what).

We only use Resources here, so we should only pass that, not then entire Context to minimize surface area and unnecessary dependencies in internal APIs.
Also, if we make these methods non-static, we can inject the Resources in the constructor and then we don't need to pass it here. This will be useful for testing as well, since we'll be able to replace the FeatureHelper with a mock or fake if necessary.

commit.message:
Use existing injectable context instead of adding another

 - this causes the dependency manager to fail because of duplicate method signatures.
